intro: Hieracium megapodium, commonly known as the giant false dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture. Hieracium megapodium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many regions.
